titles.title: Robert Emmet Park Act of 2016
Robert Emmet Park Act of 2016
Robert Emmet Park Act of 2016
To redesignate the small triangular property located in Washington, DC, and designated by the National Park Service as reservation 302 as "Robert Emmet Park", and for other purposes.
Robert Emmet Park Act of 2016

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Lands.

Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 114-750.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 144.

action.text: Mr. Denham moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4564.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands
committee.name: House Natural Resources

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the House reported version is repeated here.)
Robert Emmet Park Act of 2016
(Sec. 3) This bill redesignates as "Robert Emmet Park" the small triangular property located at the corner of 24th Street and Massachusetts Avenue NW in Washington, DC, and designated by the National Park Service as reservation 302.
The Department of the Interior may post signs on or near the park, including one or more on:
information about Robert Emmet, his contribution to Irish Independence, and his respect for the United States and the American Revolution; and information about the history of the statue of Robert Emmet located in the park.
